If you like earing plenty of cosmetics for free and/or mainly play games for PVE experience, Overwatch currently is not great and can't recommend. BUT if you're looking for solid teambased PVP experience, you will have a great time, specially if you have a group of 5 friends.

Spent 350 hours in this game throughout its lifespan, and that's just time spent in matches that aren't custom games. That doesn't include menu time and such. Downloaded it on Steam JUST to leave a bad review. This game is worth nobody's money at all, and its hardly worth your time.

Overwatch '2' is literally a downgrade from Overwatch 1. They forcibly removed player levels which were tied to lootboxes. People who committed tons of hours into Overwatch 1 were stripped of their player level emblems. Aside from the atrocious battlepass there is no longer a reason to play the game since there is no progression system. 

They forcibly made it a 5v5 instead of the classic 6v6, turning tank into a singular role. As a Reinhardt main, this applied a ton more pressure as the team's sole tank versus having a backup tank. They should have left 6v6 implemented with 5v5 as a optional gamemode. 

Lootboxes were actually not that bad, its the same system as Heroes of the Storm. You got random cosmetics and skins, and any duplicates were currency so you can buy your own skin. While it can be grindy, it at least offered a progression system. The Overwatch 2 battlepass renders this useless and is indefinitely more grindy than lootboxes were

The worst part about this is that players don't have the option to go back and play Overwatch 1. They gave a content drought for many years only to cancel on their PvE hero progression promises. Overwatch 1 gave all the new heroes, maps, and event gamemodes for free to players. Overwatch 2 removed maps and forces you to grind/pay for heroes, and forces you to buy the battlepass to participate in event gamemodes. 

Blizzard really put the "HAMMER DOWN!" and put the nail on this game's coffin
Back then I got Overwatch 1 as a gift, now I just cant help but feel bad for the poor soul who had to pay for this in the first place.

Pros
+ Now on steam
+ Accessibility options for people with colorblindess (not as customisable right now), motion sickness and poor eyesight
+ Support of more aspect ratios added back 
Cons
- The release of ow2 was just a marketing move. They didn't release any new characters during ow1 to then release 3 character at ones with ow2 to create a feeling of something productive being done while it was just postponing the release of characters.
- Free to play is not an advantage but rather a solution to the game being bad and people leaving. Ow1 had never been having problems with online while the game had good balancing and content.
-Cosmetic item prices. Legendary skins that you could get in like 2 weeks of passive playing or randomly from a FREE lootbox now cost 20$ each and furthermore you now are only able to buy some on specific days due to introduction of the shop. 
-The game tries to trick you into spending more money out of lack of knowledge of the buying system or from being clumsy. It is easy to buy something accidentally or buy useless stuff in a bundle thinking you can't buy it independently. 
-The prices. It is less costly to buy a real keychain charm in real life than it is to buy the same charm in game.
-HUD. HUD quality has fallen significantly. It is a change just for the purpose of existing and not solving anything. 
 1. The main menu was changed and now it is weirdly spaced and some buttons were moved to Escape menu which now makes you press extra buttons if you want access something quickly. 
 2. Escape menu is now not transparent. This makes it hard now to change some setting if you are in a middle of a game since you can't now see what is around you. Some people may prefer opaque menu due to motionsickness and I understand that but why not just make it a toggle option then?
 3. The option to adjust HUD borders is hidden inside game's config which can cause trouble for some people with old displays or non 16:9 aspect ratio users.
 4. Useless details being added to the first person ui like transparent lines in the corners of the screen. There is nothing wrond visually but again it's just a change for a change. It adds nothing just obscures your vision in the corners and makes the ui look weird when you adjust screen borders leaving you with floating sharp hud parts.
-Matchmaking and game modes. Quickplay is just a worse ranked. Quickplay has a SBMM system which uses hidden mmr to match people. This makes quickplay more competetive. You can get a similiar feeling of what sbmm is from games like DBD or COD MWII. Moreover there are weekly challenges that require you to win in quickplay and other non-competetive modes to get crumbs of shop currency thus resulting in sweaty games in chill modes. Quickplay doesn't even have rewards of the ranked mode.

I'm too lazy to continue with the cons of the game so I will just end it here. Don't spend a dime on the game unless things get better.
